meanings.definition: To become sour or spoiled in taste
meanings.sent1: Leaving milk out too long sours it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The fruit sours if left in the sun for too long.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when the potato salad sours and smelled terrible.
meanings.sent4: Her mood sours like milk left out in the heat.
meanings.sent5: The friendship sours after constant arguments over trivial matters.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel unhappy or disappointed
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism sours the mood of the team.
meanings.sent2: The news of the cancellation sours her excitement for the event.
meanings.sent3: His joke about her cooking skills sours the atmosphere at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The harsh reality of the situation sours her optimism.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected failure sours his enthusiasm for the project.

meanings.definition: A drink made with lemon or lime juice and sugar, often mixed with alcohol
meanings.sent1: She ordered a refreshing glass of sours at the bar.
meanings.sent2: The bartender recommended trying their special sours cocktail.
meanings.sent3: The fruity sours was the perfect choice for a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The zesty sours danced on her taste buds with each sip.
meanings.sent5: The citrusy aroma of the sours cocktail was inviting and delightful.
